tags.name: v1.0.0
tags.body: Go mod

tags.name: v2.0.0
tags.body:
Merge pull request #65 from SimonRichardson/charm-dependencies

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/65

As the charm brings in dependency breaking changes (prefix for bundles are required), this ensures that all consumers of this library are fully exposed to the fact that the underlying charm and charmrepo changes are breaking changes and I’m forcing bundlechanges users to understand this.

The number of changes inside go mod and sum are a bit concerning, but all the tests pass, so I’m inclined to leave it as-is for now.

tags.name: v1.0.0
tags.body:
Merge pull request #64 from SimonRichardson/deterministic-master

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/64

The following ensure that the applications that we loop through are deterministic, so that when adding application units we skip correctly with in the loop.

This is fixing LP #1883645

releases.body:
The Juju team is proud to release Juju 3.6.14!

This is a point release to the stable 3.6 series of Juju.

Checkout the Juju 3.6.14 Release Notes

What’s Changed

  • chore: increment juju to 3.6.14 by @jujubot in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21588
  • feat: limit api port access for the controller using juju expose by @adglkh in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20682
  • feat(fatal-login-error): add fatal login error code and logic to tryinorderloginprovider by @SimoneDutto in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21541
  • docs: fix leftover terminal and blueprint issues by @tmihoc in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21578
  • docs: add 3.6.13 release notes by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21610
  • refactor: secret iaas vault integration test by @CodingCookieRookie in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21597
  • docs: add links to 3.6.13 release notes PR references by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21614
  • docs: update readme and build instructions in contributing by @iyiguncevik in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21575
  • feat: update dqlite 1.18.5 by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21656
  • feat: update dqlite 1.18.5 deps by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21658
  • feat: apply db limits to prevent pool exhaustion by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21649
  • chore: revert “Merge pull request #20682 from adglkh/limit_api_port” by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/21661

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/juju/compare/v3.6.13…v3.6.14

releases.title: Juju 4.0.1
releases.body:
The Juju team is proud to release Juju 4.0.1!

This is a point release to the stable 4.0 series of Juju.

Checkout the Juju 4.0.1 Release Notes

What’s Changed

  • chore(deps): bump golang.org/x/net from 0.42.0 to 0.43.0 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20387

releases.title: 3.6.1.3 - Mind your Ps and Qs
releases.body:
This release of python-libjuju fixes a nasty bug where trailing ‘P’, ‘Q’, and ‘=’ characters were stripped from secret values. This is a good reminder to migrate your charm’s Juju integration tests to jubilant if possible.

Note that python-libjuju is not under active development, and will only receive critical bugfixes and security fixes for Juju 3.6. There are no plans to support Juju 4.0, so please migrate to jubilant.

What’s Changed

  • fix: don’t strip valid characters from secret data by @james-garner-canonical in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1276
  • chore: release 3.6.1.3 by @james-garner-canonical in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1278

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/3.6.1.2…3.6.1.3

Belated release notes and tag for 3.6.1.2 release on May 26, 2025.

What’s Changed

  • chore: hint machine addresses as list of dicts by @gboutry in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1258
  • ci: disable test that fails on all Juju versions by @dimaqq in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1268
  • fix: creating offer when connecting to existing model, fixes #1264 by @dimaqq in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1265
  • chore: release 3.6.1.2 by @dimaqq in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1271

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/3.6.1.1…3.6.1.2

What’s Changed

  • chore: fix changelog format by @dimaqq in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1248
  • docs: move docs from juju.is by @tmihoc in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1244
  • chore: type hint improvements from the helper thread branch by @dimaqq in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1250
  • chore: remove pyrfc3339 and change to datetime.datetime.fromisoformat by @EdmilsonRodrigues in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1247

releases.body:
What’s Changed

This is a small bugfix update from previous versions, though there is one small behavioral change.

The primary fix is that previously if you did ExpBackoff(min=1.0, max=200, factor=2.0, jitter=false), then the times would be in the expected 1.0, 2.0, 4.0. Up to the max. However, when you set jitter=true, while it would preserve the maximum to be the same time as the original backoff, it would pick a random value from 0ms to the max delay, and then truncate that to the minDelay. Which meant that it actually changed the average wait time to something close to 50% of the expected times.

The new logic does a +/- 20% from the expected delay, and then caps that at min and max. This averages very close to the expected values (in testing, the over time difference is around a 1% shift.)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/retry/compare/v1.0.0…v1.0.1## What’s Changed * fix: cleanup our handling of jitter and other misc by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/retry/pull/12

releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • httptesting: fix for Go 1.6 by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/93

  • testing: don’t panic during TearDownTest if SetUpTest failed by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/101
  • Added BSONEquals checker by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • Detect mongod version before starting test server by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/104
  • lp:1596045 handle CRLF in mongo version line by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/105
  • copy clock from juju/juju/testing by @jrwren in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/106
  • Update to use the latest loggo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/107
  • Retry mgo dial if unexpected message. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/109
  • Hook up mgo logging and reconnect properly. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/110
  • add NewProxiedSession by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/111
  • implement Clock.NewTimer by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/108
  • Bump mongo error output to 100 lines by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • Update testing.Clock to improve robustness by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/113
  • NewProxiedSession - ping to assign a socket to the returned session. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • checkers: ignore time zone in DeepEqual by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/115
  • MongoDB needs –key=value not –key value now by @dooferlad in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/116
  • Fixes for replicaset by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • Introduces a type which can be used to mock calls by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/118
  • tcpproxy: add pause and resume to the stream by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/119
  • Disable mgo logging/debugging by default by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/120
  • Mongo 3.4 uses a different string to indicate it is ready for connections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/121
  • Fix EchoQuotedArgsUnix/AssertEchoArgs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/122
  • Fix PatchExecutableAsEchoArgs on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/124
  • Prefer mongod 3.2 and improve mongod info caching by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • Default mongo storage backend to mmapv1 by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/126
  • Add MgoInstance.SSLEnabled method by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/125
  • Remove deprecated –sslOnNormalPorts arg to mongod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/127
  • Fix typo in mongo command by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/128
  • Stub check calls without order. by @anastasiamac in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • testing: default to mmapv1 only on x86(_64) by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/133
  • Don’t try to truncate the local replicaset oplog. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/135
  • Changes to support Mongo 3.6. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/136
  • Expose the version of Mongo that we are testing against. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/137
  • enable vendor as the highest priority import path by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • Add short and long timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/139
  • Use juju/clock by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/140
  • Add the location of mongod in bionic to the list of places we look. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/141
  • Enable Mongo with Replica Sets by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/142
  • If using Replicaset use wiredTiger. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/143

releases.title: v2.1.1
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Use const errors for exported errors. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/68

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/txn/compare/v2.1.0…v2.1.1

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Expose PruneTxns in order to allow external tools to use it by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/16
  • Add progress logging while pruning transactions by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/17
  • Retry errors that finish with ‘unexpected message’. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • Add export_test.go by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/19
  • Use mgo.Collection.Bulk to prune docs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/20
  • Add RunTransaction observer by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/21
  • Use disk-based pruning strategy by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/22
  • Make prune log output consistent by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/23
  • Cleanup txn.Stash as part of regular pruning by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • Cleanup all collections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/25
  • Don’t create transactions that have no operations. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/27
  • Abstract out “Completed Transaction” functionality by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/26
  • Properly test no-op does the right thing, as does real errors. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/28
  • Add a command-line utility to clean and purge txns. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • Add logging information about the pruning result. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/29
  • Turns out it isn’t safe to use aggregation in 2.4 at all. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/31
  • support using RemoveAll($in) instead of Bulk. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/32
  • Various cleanups by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/35
  • track what is actually removed by Oracle.RemoveTxns() by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/34
  • Expose a NewestTime for PruneOptions. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/36
  • Handle Bulk.Run() result being nil by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/37
  • When observing transactions include the run Duration. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/40
  • Change Clock back to being optional. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/41
  • Allow passing in a parameter to limit the number of transactions evaluated by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/42
  • Expose the batch size and number of batches. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/43
  • No need for uint64 and it makes default printing ugly by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/44
  • Use juju/clock package for the clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/45
  • Incremental prune by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/46
  • 2.4 prune options by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/47
  • Pass the transaction attempt by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • Revert “Merge pull request #48 from SimonRichardson/txn-attempt” by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/51
  • Add testing.SetFailIfTransaction. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/49
  • Retry i/o timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/52
  • Thread through the transaction by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/50
  • juju/txn with server side transactions by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/55
  • Add help text to explain why hooks do not run by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • Properly handle when RemoveAll returns an error. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/57
  • Use github.com/juju/mgo/v2 and convert to go mod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/58
  • Add extra txn backoff tuning parameters for sstxn by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/59
  • Make retry fuzz a percent and use durations instead of floats by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/60
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/61
  • Add support for no change log, used when upgrading to SSTXN. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • @jameinel made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • @cmars made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/txn/commits/v2.0.0

releases.title: juju-restore v0.13
releases.body: Add support for cloning secret backends to the --copy-controller option. See #24 .

releases.title: juju-restore v0.12
releases.body: Add a new --copy-controller option to initialise a new controller to look like a backed up controller. This is useful when setting up a controller for a newer Juju version and copying to that new controller users, clouds, and config from an existing controller. See #23.

releases.title: v2.0 (alpha 1)
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Add docs for disabling alert rules by @sed-i in #1
  • add security.md file by @simskij in #2
  • feat(docs): migrate minio guide by @simskij in #3
  • feat(docs): migrate design goals explanation by @simskij in #8
  • feat(docs): migrate tutorial for syncing alert rules by @simskij in #4
  • feat(docs): migrate instrument machine charms by @simskij in #6
  • feat(docs): migrate tutorial for setting up distributed storage by @simskij in #7
  • fix: Repair a link and refresh COS status view by @mmkay in #10
  • feat(doc): migrate majority of references and juju topology articles by @simskij in #9
  • cos lite prod best practices doc by @PietroPasotti in #12
  • fix: Current tracing endpoints in how-to on tracing by @mmkay in #13
  • feat(docs): migrate logging architecture doc by @simskij in #17
  • feat(doc): migrate security docs by @simskij in #14
  • feat(docs): migrate telemetry flow and data integrity docs by @simskij in #15
  • feat: add docs on migrating from gagent to otelcol by @lucabello in #18
  • Expand TLS section by @sed-i in #20
  • Remove redundant set-up-distributed-storage.md by @michaeldmitry in #24
  • added model topology doc by @PietroPasotti in #11
  • improve: LMA to COS migration docs by @MichaelThamm in #27
  • Minor fixes by @sed-i in #25
  • feat: migrate telemetry labels doc by @PietroPasotti in #16
  • improve integrating-cos-lite-with-uncharmed-applications.md by @lucabello in #21
  • Update index.rst by @dstathis in #22
  • Update testing-with-minio.md by @PietroPasotti in #23
  • Update instrument-machine-charms.md by @Abuelodelanada in #26
  • Various fixes by @sed-i in #29
  • Bump tar-fs from 3.0.8 to 3.0.9 in /docs/.sphinx by @dependabot[bot] in #30
  • feat(tutorial): add “COS Lite on Canonical K8s” by @sed-i in #32
  • feat(reference): add page for supported tracks by @sed-i in #31
  • feat: add basic tutorial for COS by @lucabello in #34
  • feat: move COS terraform modules from observability repo by @MichaelThamm in #36
  • fix: Offers and components outputs for COS Lite by @MichaelThamm in #43
  • Manual sync from starter pack by @sed-i in #52
  • Update instances of “observability-docs” to “observability-stack” by @sed-i in #53
  • feat: COS Lite TF module TLS integrations by @MichaelThamm in #40
  • fix: add missing relations from cos module by @lucabello in #44
  • feat(doc): upkeep by @sed-i in #51
  • fix: Breaking 0.20.0 juju provider juju_offers endpoint -> endpoints by @MichaelThamm in #62
  • feat(doc): compare COS variants by @sed-i in #57
  • fix: remove clutter from cos tutorial by @lucabello in #58
  • feat(how-to): Evaluate telemetry volume by @sed-i in #66
  • feat: Charm revisions in COS Lite by @MichaelThamm in #69
  • feat: COS certificates integrations (e-2-e TLS) by @MichaelThamm in #60
  • feat(tutorial): add reproducer for COS tutorial by @sed-i in #68
  • chore(docs): upkeep by @sed-i in #72
  • feat: Add TLS modes with a How-to doc by @MichaelThamm in #71
  • chore: Update use_tls to internal_tls by @MichaelThamm in #77
  • feat: Surface charm module configs in the product module by @MichaelThamm in #75
  • chore: Revert source to GH by @MichaelThamm in #80
  • feat: Organize product module inputs by @MichaelThamm in #79
  • chore: Revert TF sources back to GH from locals by @MichaelThamm in #81
  • feat: Add Terraform README docs generation into CI by @MichaelThamm in #78
  • (feature): Replace grafana-agent with opentelemetry-collector by @Abuelodelanada in #82
  • fix: Justfile cleanup by @MichaelThamm in #83
  • fix: COS TF model in tutorial by @MichaelThamm in #84
  • feature: Add a mention to a Juju bug in our docs by @Abuelodelanada in #86
  • feat: Loki TF module now matches other module APIs by @MichaelThamm in #89
  • feat: How-to docs for otelcol dropping telemetry and tiering processors by @MichaelThamm in #93
  • feature: redact logs tutorial added by @Abuelodelanada in #95
  • fix: sitemap URLs and slug for 404 rendering by @SecondSkoll in #88
  • Add troubleshooting guide for “no data” in grafana panels by @sed-i in #98

New Contributors

  • @sed-i made their first contribution in #1
  • @simskij made their first contribution in #2
  • @mmkay made their first contribution in #10
  • @PietroPasotti made their first contribution in #12
  • @lucabello made their first contribution in #18
  • @michaeldmitry made their first contribution in #24
  • @MichaelThamm made their first contribution in #27
  • @dstathis made their first contribution in #22
  • @Abuelodelanada made their first contribution in #26
  • @dependabot[bot] made their first contribution in #30
  • @SecondSkoll made their first contribution in #88

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/observability-stack/commits/2.0a1

releases.title: track/0.5: v1.0.0
releases.body:
1.0.0 (2025-11-21)

BREAKING CHANGES

  • drop public and admin ingresses, rewrite internal ingress to internal route

Features

  • add name to the create and update actions (38f3b33)
  • add terraform module (531ded2)
  • add the terraform module for the charm (d69a806)
  • expose client-uri via cli (09e92b1)
  • expose contacts via cli (8f007cc)
  • introduce public-route relation (1c1f1bc)
  • List all details except secrets in list-oauth-clients output (e5fbd2a)
  • List all details except secrets in list-oauth-clients output (3b10539)
  • update juju_application resource name (70a330f)
  • upgrade to v2 tracing (45d5703)
  • use tracing v2 (f2a0250)

Bug Fixes

  • add collect_status handler (e76ba94)
  • add config to prepopulate the hydra keys (3a9a459)
  • add health check handlers (ce8c745)
  • add pod constraints (f0b011c)
  • add reconcile-oauth-clients action (0789efc)
  • add secret management actions (0449395)
  • add serializer for metadata (f10cf75)
  • add token hook integration (8807ab4)
  • address CVEs (6075941), closes #297
  • block charm if not integrated with ui (f3726e4)
  • block the charm when public ingress is not secured in non-dev mode (d2df5c1)
  • do not always set maintenance status (de9678c)
  • do not remove client on relation_broken (4f16be0), closes #268
  • don’t restart service if config didn’t change (3d7f6b3)
  • drop public and admin ingresses, rewrite internal ingress to internal route (d2b56d5)
  • fix constraint (6a74fed)
  • fix tests (db5c0ff)
  • fix tests (0d6456f)
  • fix the internal ingress configuration (a90baab)
  • fix the issue that disregards the dev mode when dev config is set to true (4a0ee32)
  • fix the lint (e0e34a9)
  • fix the lint ci and traefik charm in integration test (7f21c54)
  • go to WaitingStatus if ingress not ready (2ef7bbc), closes #145
  • handle event being emitted multiple times (e5b9bcf)
  • improve route integration handling logic (28392b5)
  • mark ui relation as mandatory (b3b82bd)
  • move to loki v1 for log forwarder (64ebad4)
  • move to use log forwarder across the board (b2d7d25)
  • provide optional flag in charmcraft.yaml (358e91f)
  • remove the storedstate to fix the missing config file issue when pod gets recreated (2c492ce)
  • remove the storedstate to fix the missing config file issue when the pod gets recreated (ba710b8)
  • stop service when database is gone (8d3f400)
  • switch to use -route relations in the tf module (5856b84)
  • update charm dependent libs (81df22f)
  • update charm dependent libs (dd8d12f)
  • update charm libs (85f17a0)
  • update to juju 0.20 and switch to use endpoints (7bf6da8)
  • update to use juju 0.20 (107cb5b)
  • upgrade tf module to use 1.0.0 syntax (9e1acf2)
  • use oidc_error_url (90efa62)
  • use oidc_error_url in config (fafa239)
  • use owner and name for model ds (7c3a403)
  • use proper charm name (7044ff3)
  • use proper intergration name for internal route (68168de)
  • use storedstate to check if config changed (1e8d58e)
  • use terraform module in deployment (31ed04a)
  • wait for login ui integration to be ready (763c825)

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
2.0.0 (2025-11-17)

BREAKING CHANGES

  • drop public and admin ingresses, rewrite internal ingress to internal route

Features

  • introduce public-route relation (1c1f1bc)
  • List all details except secrets in list-oauth-clients output (e5fbd2a)
  • List all details except secrets in list-oauth-clients output (3b10539)
  • update juju_application resource name (70a330f)

Bug Fixes

  • add collect_status handler (e76ba94)
  • add config to prepopulate the hydra keys (3a9a459)
  • add health check handlers (ce8c745)
  • add secret management actions (0449395)
  • drop public and admin ingresses, rewrite internal ingress to internal route (d2b56d5)
  • improve route integration handling logic (28392b5)
  • remove the storedstate to fix the missing config file issue when pod gets recreated (2c492ce)
  • remove the storedstate to fix the missing config file issue when the pod gets recreated (ba710b8)
  • stop service when database is gone (8d3f400)
  • switch to use -route relations in the tf module (5856b84)
  • update charm dependent libs (81df22f)
  • upgrade tf module to use 1.0.0 syntax (9e1acf2)
  • use owner and name for model ds (7c3a403)
  • use proper intergration name for internal route (68168de)
  • use terraform module in deployment (31ed04a)

commits.author: Lucian Petrut
commits.message:
Drop custom tigera operator patches (#3)

The Tigera operator expects the ImageSet specs to contain the original image names, not the custom ones. We’ll drop our custom patches and update the integration tests accordingly.

We need to remove “calico-ctl” from the image spec as the Tigera operator does not expect it and is going to throw an error.

While at it, we’ll avoid using the “match” expression since it’s unsupported on 22.04.

releases.title: Release v0.6.0
releases.body:
What’s new

k8s-dqlite removed as a datastore option

This is a critical breaking change. The k8s-dqlite datastore option has been removed from CAPI-CK8s starting with v0.6.0 (#203).

k8s-dqlite was deprecated in Canonical Kubernetes 1.35 and will be removed entirely in Canonical Kubernetes 1.36. As a result, this provider no longer supports k8s-dqlite as a datastore backend.

Impact

  • Clusters using k8s-dqlite cannot upgrade from v0.5.x to v0.6.0.
  • There is no migration path from k8s-dqlite to etcd for existing clusters.

Recommended Actions

If your cluster is currently using k8s-dqlite as the datastore:

  1. Do not upgrade: Continue using CAPI-CK8s v0.5.x if you need to maintain your existing cluster with k8s-dqlite.
  2. Create a new cluster: If you want to use v0.6.0+, provision a new cluster with etcd as the datastore and migrate your workloads.

All new clusters provisioned with v0.6.0 and later will use etcd as the datastore.

Bug fixes

  • Fix stray quotes in --provider-id for OpenStack templates, which was preventing control plane nodes from bootstrapping correctly (#202) - Fixes #178
  • Update Incus version to v0.8.3 to fix failing CI (#200)
  • Fix snap install to not use the --dangerous flag, which was breaking rolling upgrades for minor k8s versions (#193)

Security

  • Bump golang.org/x/crypto from 0.36.0 to 0.45.0

Chores & CI

  • Preparation for v0.6.0 release (204)
  • Remove CODEOWNERS file (#198)
  • Bump staticcheck to latest version for TICS (#196)
  • Remove harden-runner from CI (#187)

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Changes falcosidekick and falcosidekick-ui rock bases to bare (#21)

Switching to a bare-based image will reduce the overall image size and reduces attack surface area.

We can no longer use ensure_image_contains_paths to check if files exist in the rock images, since they are now bare-based. Instead, we can use ensure_image_contains_paths_bare, which checks the image layers instead. Because of this, we need sufficient permissions to check the /var/lib/docker folder.

Adds additional check for falcosidekick-ui during the integration test.

tags.name: v2.1.0
tags.body:
Change project name detection on prepare statements (#2)

Any changes to the folder/repository causes an issue with statement registrations, to address this the hard coded name is updated to use the caller project.

tags.name: v2.0.2
tags.body:
Add back legacy /cluster/internal/database endpoint (#224)

We renamed /cluster/internal, /cluster/control, and /cluster/1.0 to /core/... but this leads to an issue when upgrading from v1 to v2 where the newer members cannot connect to dqlite until all un-upgraded members are offline. This is because the dqlite leader will still be communicating over /cluster/internal/database.

This makes upgrades noticeably slower, while also undoing the work we had done earlier to show upgrade progress with the cluster list command, because we can’t connect to dqlite to inspect the schema versions. Instead, the daemon just reports Database is still starting because the dqlite connection cannot be established. The upgrade still does work, it just takes an additional 30-60s or so because the upgraded daemons will be constantly restarting until all cluster members have been upgraded.

To work around this, we can add back /cluster/internal/database as a core API endpoint. For the most part, this won’t be used, as it will only be relevant while upgrading from an existing setup that uses the old API endpoints. This path will be reserved so extension servers cannot use /cluster/internal/database as a path.

Functionally, when establishing a connection to dqlite, if we encounter a 404 error on /core/internal/database, we will try /cluster/internal/database as a fallback, allowing us to connect to legacy systems to compare schema versions.

Rather than adding this to v3 and backporting to v2, I thought we might as well fully drop the legacy support from v3 since it likely won’t be released for some time, meaning direct upgrades from v1->v3 should be rather sparse. And since this doesn’t actually affect the result of an upgrade, I don’t think it’s worth the extra maintenance.

tags.name: v2.0.1
tags.body:
(backport v2) Parse go module version out of project name (#221)

This helper finds microcluster among the cached build files to register internal statements. Since microcluster’s module path has been appended with v2, this function now resolves to v2 as the project name instead of microcluster, so this commit properly checks if the path is of the form v[number] and if so, looks one directory back instead.

This should fix external projects failing to register internal microcluster prepared statements.

Signed-off-by: Max Asnaashari max.asnaashari@canonical.com (cherry picked from commit aaec49fa6823ddf8802336b3affbbe8878cc6a52)

commits.author: Niamh Hennigan
commits.message:
docs: Combine networking pages (#2352)

  • Move networking explanation pages into one page

We are trying to reduce the size and complexity of our navigation so I am moving the networking explanation pages into one networking page

  • Address CI failures and Copilot review comments

  • Address review comments

Louise made a good point about this explanation page going from very high level networking concepts to quite in depth, more expert level detail which makes this page confusing to new users and partly redundant for more advanced users. I decided to remove the generic networking section and instead shift the focus onto what Canonical Kubernetes does with networking

  • Minor review comments changes

  • Linting

  • Add links to ignore list

commits.author: Niamh Hennigan
commits.message:
ci: Move linkcheck logic out for weekly tests (#2276)

  • Begin moving linkcheck logic out for weekly tests

Linkchecker on PR 2202 is changing the linkchecker to only run on git diff. We want to move the logic out of docs checks so we can call this from our weekly tests on the entire docs set

  • Add branch testing matrix

  • Move linkcheck logic

Remove duplication of linkcheck logic by making it modular so it can be called by the weekly test suite as well as the pr level testing

  • Debug linkcheck not passed git diff

The CI is running linkcheck on . rather than git diff so trying to fix that here

  • Update changed files formatting

We now generate git diff in a separate step so we need to change the way we format the output of changed_files to reflect this

  • Added line to debug

  • Debug ‘

  • Fix typo in spacing

  • Add logic to allow forks contributions

  • Add repo to outputs and fix indentation error

  • Fix typo with missing }

  • Fix error with default value

Default value should be blank rather than . to run on all files in the repo

  • Add check to add FILES var

Only pass the FILES variable if there are files provided. Otherwise run check on all docs i.e pass no FILES var

  • Copilot review comments

  • Fix error with ref

ref was named as branch in the outputs so it was not being passed to the checkout function. It was therefore running all tests on main, not the release branches

  • Review comments

  • Remove weekly test and update links

For the purposes of backporting these changes to other branches and properly testing the linkchecker weekly test, I am removing the docs check from this PR and will follow up with a PR soley with that change only targeting main. I also updated some out of date links and added a link to the ignore list

  • Fix broken link in charm page

  • Attempt to fix “ issue

The test is picking up when there are no docs files and running the entire docs set but it is reading the files wrong and not running the linkcheck on any files

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Adds arm64 to rock images (#36)

  • Adds arm64 to rock images

Previously, we’ve skipped adding support for arm64 since some of the rocks failed to build for arm64.

  • Fixes longhorn-manager arm64 rocks

The iputils snap does nto have an arm64 target, so we can’t use that for arm64.

The iputils rpm from suse (installed in the original Dockerfile) contains the following binaries: arping, clockdiff, ping, tracepath. It also contains symlinks for ping6 and tracepath6.

We’ll be installing equivalent apt packages for those binaries to keep parity.

  • Fixes v1.7.0 longhorn-engine and longhorn-instance-manager arm64 rocks

When building tgt, we’re getting this error on arm64:

bs.c: In function bs_sig_request_done:
bs.c:196:15: error: read writing 1 byte into a region of size 0 overflows the destination [-Werror=stringop-overflow=]
  196 |         ret = read(fd, (char *)siginfo, sizeof(siginfo));
      |               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
bs.c:193:33: note: destination object siginfo of size 0
  193 |         struct signalfd_siginfo siginfo[16];
      |                                 ^~~~~~~
In file included from /usr/include/unistd.h:1217,
                 from bs.c:33:
/usr/include/aarch64-linux-gnu/bits/unistd.h:26:1: note: in a call to function read declared with attribute access (write_only, 2)
   26 | read (int __fd, void *__buf, size_t __nbytes)
      | ^~~~
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
make[1]: *** [Makefile:95: bs.o] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/root/parts/build-tgt/build/usr'
make: *** [Makefile:24: programs] Error 2
'override-build' in part 'build-tgt' failed with code 2.

After some investigation, it seems that this Warning is not a false positive. Because # if defined(__NR_signalfd) is false, signalfd_siginfo is an empty structure, which means that siginfo is actually an array of elements that have 0 bytes in size. It seems that on arm64, there’s only __NR_signalfd4, not __NR_signalfd.

Interestingly, this does not occur on ubuntu 22.04, which is why we’re not seeing this issue in the v1.6.2 rocks.

xref: https://www.spinics.net/lists/linux-stgt/msg04783.html

This patch is a cherry-pick of the following commit (+ resolved conflicts), which solves this issue:

https://github.com/fujita/tgt/commit/7ea559753e647e6a5fa5a0ca3c29ba417d9744b7

releases.title: Microk8s 1.35 released!
releases.body:
In this release

Kubernetes 1.35

Read more at https://kubernetes.io/blog/2025/12/17/kubernetes-v1-35-release/

Bugfixes

  • Remove deprecated etcd-v2 flag by @berkayoz in #5212
  • Allow sockets in cri-containerd AppArmor profile by @bschimke95 in #5218
  • Add endpointslice to node rbac by @berkayoz in #5227
  • Relax cri-containerd AppArmor restrictions to permit network and signal syscalls by @jadams in #5239
  • Use 1.8.1 k8s-dqlite by @ethandcosta in #5304
  • Preserve individual environment variables with sudo by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #5319
  • Include IngressClass for determining addon status by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #5337
  • Replace nginx ingress with Traefik in validation and image conf by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #5339
  • Improve compatibility for dashboard installation in different namespaces by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #5345

Updates

  • Update component versions by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #5318
    • rook-ceph 1.18.7
    • observability stack - Prometheus 77.6.2, Loki 2.10.3, Tempo 1.24.1
    • GPU operator 25.10.0, Network Operator 25.7.0
    • CoreDNS 1.13.1
    • Kubernetes dashboard 7.14.0
    • cert-manager 1.19.1
  • Add Kubernetes 1.35 patches by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #5320
  • Bump containerd to 2.1.3 and update build process by @berkayoz in #5321
  • Deprecate MinIO by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #378
  • Replace NGINX ingress with Traefik by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #375

New Contributors

  • @jadams made their first contribution in #5239

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/microk8s/compare/v1.34…v1.35

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Changes rock base to bare (#6)

Switching to a bare-based image will reduce the overall image size and reduces attack surface area.

The original Dockerfile uses gcr.io/distroless/static:nonroot, which has only a few packages. We can add those packages and switch to a bare-based image. Additionally, the original image is a non-root image, thus, we should also switch our rock to be non-root.

We can no longer use ensure_image_contains_paths to check if files exist in the rock images, since they are now bare-based. Instead, we can use ensure_image_contains_paths_bare, which checks the image layers instead. Because of this, we need sufficient permissions to check the /var/lib/docker folder.

commits.author: Mateo Florido
commits.message:
feat: improve integration test suites (#10)

  • Refactored the test file to use three themed test classes: TestDeployment, TestStorageProvisioning, and TestVolumeLifecycle.
  • Added test_deploy_pools to verify multi-pool charm deployment with node selectors and independent storage classes, and test_storage_classes_created to ensure storage classes are created as expected.
  • Implemented test_multiple_providers to validate that PVCs are provisioned and bound to the correct storage pools, pods are scheduled appropriately, and data is correctly written/read for each pool.
  • Added test_volume_deletion_with_delete_policy and test_volume_retain_policy to verify correct behavior for ‘Delete’ and ‘Retain’ reclaim policies, including PV deletion or retention after PVC removal, and proper cleanup of resources.

Co-authored-by: addyess 10090033+addyess@users.noreply.github.com

tags.body: build: bump version 0.3.5->0.3.6 (#53)

Gracefully handle empty remote app name (#35)

  • Gracefully handle empty remote app name

It shouldn’t ever happen but it seems that the remote app name can be set to blank during a relation-broken hook in some strange edge case which leads to a ModelError during SDI.__init__(). This handles that case more gracefully.

Fixes #34

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Changes rock base to bare (#11)

Switching to a bare-based image will reduce the overall image size and reduces attack surface area.

The image is supposed to run a script, thus we need a few packages installed.

ddptool is not statically built, so it still depends on /lib and /lib64, which is why we’re adding base-files.

Switch the container user to root. It is supposed to have access to certain host folders through hostPath mounts, and thus, it should be able to modify them (e.g.: create /var/log/sriovdp folder).

We can no longer use ensure_image_contains_paths to check if files exist in the rock images, since they are now bare-based. Instead, we can use ensure_image_contains_paths_bare, which checks the image layers instead. Because of this, we need sufficient permissions to check the /var/lib/docker folder.

commits.author: Konstantinos Tsakalozos
commits.message: feat: pin k8s-test-harness (#17)

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Changes rock bases to bare (#16)

Switching to a bare-based image will reduce the overall image size and reduces attack surface area.

The whereabouts image is supposed to install the binaries on the host it’s running on. For this, it runs a bash script, which is why we still need a few stage packages. Note that the helm chart uses pgrep in a readiness / liveness probe.

We can no longer use ensure_image_contains_paths to check if files exist in the rock images, since they are now bare-based. Instead, we can use ensure_image_contains_paths_bare, which checks the image layers instead. Because of this, we need sufficient permissions to check the /var/lib/docker folder.

Adds an extra sanity check during the integration tests, making sure that there is no error reported in Pebble while starting the service.

releases.title: v1.4.0
releases.body:
Highlights: a new optional field, “hint”, is now supported as part of a slice’s definition, allowing you to provide a concise and unopinionated description of the subset of contents coming from a slice. A new format, v3, has also been introduced, finalizing support for the new architecture-specific essentials.

What’s Changed

  • fix: handle default arch in Select by @upils in #256
  • feat: hints on slices by @upils in #263
  • fix: remove traversals calling ubuntuIndex.fetch by @upils in #257
  • feat: format v3 by @letFunny in #249

New Contributors

  • @upils made their first contribution in #256

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v1.3.0…v1.4.0

releases.title: v1.3.0
releases.body:
Highlights: this release introduces support for unmaintained and unstable Ubuntu releases via a new --ignore option. It also includes fixes for CVEs GO-2025-3956/CVE-2025-47906 and GO-2025-3922/CVE-2025-58058.

What’s Changed

  • fix: remove redundant check by @letFunny in #230
  • feat: debug command to check release archives by @letFunny in #229
  • feat: emit a warning when implicit parent conflict found by @letFunny in #232
  • feat: check if implicit conflict is handled in slice definitions by @letFunny in #236
  • fix: improve invalid slice name error by @gajeshbhat in #240
  • Use modern Go constructs by @HadrienPatte in #215
  • feat: support unmaintained and unstable Ubuntu releases by @letFunny in #238
  • chore: bump versions to fix CVE by @zhijie-yang in #244
  • ci: add scheduled tics code analysis workflows by @cjdcordeiro in #243
  • feat: typos by @lczyk in #247
  • feat: allow multiple ignores by @lczyk in #245
  • feat: add v3-essential to support arch-specific essentials by @letFunny in #246
  • bugfix: revert change to transitive dependencies (essential) by @letFunny in #248

New Contributors

  • @gajeshbhat made their first contribution in #240
  • @lczyk made their first contribution in #247

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v1.2.0…v1.3.0

releases.title: v1.2.0
releases.body:
Highlights: this release introduces support for hard links and handling of path conflicts. It also exposes jsonwall and manifest as Apache-2.0 packages, for easier integration with 3rd party CVE scanners and SBOM generators. A new format, v2, is introduced in this release.

What’s Changed

  • fix: wrong help text for version command by @cjdcordeiro in #183
  • chore(snap): rename system-files interface by @cjdcordeiro in #190
  • feat: add support for hard links by @letFunny in #179
  • chore(ci): bump artifact actions to v4 by @zhijie-yang in #193
  • chore(snap): add security advisory and contact email by @zhijie-yang in #192
  • chore: expose manifest reading and jsonwall as packages by @letFunny in #182
  • chore(deps,build,ci): bump Golang to v1.22 by @zhijie-yang in #200
  • feat: add performance testing in the ci by @letFunny in #196
  • chore(ci): bump artifact actions to v4 by @letFunny in #202
  • feat: add support for path conflicts with ‘prefer’ by @letFunny in #201
  • chore(deps): update canonical/has-signed-canonical-cla action to v2 by @cjdcordeiro in #210
  • feat: cannot extract files outside the target directory by @letFunny in #205
  • chore: update Go version to 1.22.12 for security fixes by @nilsdebruin in #211
  • bugfix: revert disabling TopLevelControl by @letFunny in #214
  • fix: ci real archive tests on supported image by @letFunny in #218
  • refactor: simplify conflict algorithm by @letFunny in #216
  • feat: finish support for path conflicts with ‘prefer’ by @letFunny in #204
  • ci: ubuntu-20.04 runner image is deprecated by @letFunny in #225
  • fix: script errors when root is / by @letFunny in #224
  • feat: add support for v2 format by @letFunny in #197
  • feat: update to Go-1.23 by @letFunny in #219

New Contributors

  • @zhijie-yang made their first contribution in #193
  • @nilsdebruin made their first contribution in #211

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v1.1.0…v1.2.0

Special thanks to the contributors that made this release happen: @Guno327, @alithethird, @arturo-seijas, @asanvaq, @bepri, @cjdcordeiro, @erinecon, @jahn-junior, @javierdelapuente, @renovate, @renovate[bot] and @tigarmo

releases.title: Release v0.0.1
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Add integration test and publish workflows by @weiiwang01 in #2
  • Refactor code and improve HTTP relay by @weiiwang01 in #3
  • Apply suggestions from Ben Hoyt’s review by @weiiwang01 in #5
  • Add custom listen address support by @weiiwang01 in #6
  • feat: arm64 arch support for snap by @yanksyoon in #7
  • Bump golang.org/x/crypto from 0.14.0 to 0.17.0 by @dependabot[bot] in #9
  • Fix shutdown behaviour by @pcallewaert in #10
  • Add the jammy tag to workflow by @mthaddon in #15
  • Bump golang.org/x/crypto from 0.17.0 to 0.31.0 by @dependabot[bot] in #16
  • Support ppc64le and s390x by @weiiwang01 in #17
  • Add missing CODEOWNERS file by @seb4stien in #18
  • Fix getsockopt syscall on s390x by @weiiwang01 in #19
  • Fix the publish workflow by @weiiwang01 in #20
  • Fix the publish workflow by @weiiwang01 in #21
  • Check proxy error before checking proxy response by @weiiwang01 in #22
  • Add support for HTTP traffic on port 11371 (HKP protocol) by @weiiwang01 in #25
  • Bump golang.org/x/crypto from 0.33.0 to 0.35.0 by @dependabot[bot] in #24
  • Handle fragmented client hello by @weiiwang01 in #30
  • Add generic TCP4 support by @nrobinaubertin in #31
  • Fix HTTP protocol version replacement in HTTP/1.0 requests by @weiiwang01 in #26
  • Sync GitHub issues to Jira by @seb4stien in #32
  • Use new team name in CODEOWNERS by @seb4stien in #33
  • End PrereadConn before starting TCP relay by @weiiwang01 in #35
  • Add security policy by @seb4stien in #36
  • Bump golang.org/x/crypto from 0.35.0 to 0.45.0 by @dependabot[bot] in #39
  • Use secret deployed via platform-engineering-repos-secrets by @seb4stien in #40
  • Add Jira product by @seb4stien in #42
  • Fall back to original destination IP if no SNI in the TLS handshake by @weiiwang01 in #43
  • Add release workflow by @swetha1654 in #44

New Contributors

  • @weiiwang01 made their first contribution in #2
  • @yanksyoon made their first contribution in #7
  • @dependabot[bot] made their first contribution in #9
  • @pcallewaert made their first contribution in #10
  • @mthaddon made their first contribution in #15
  • @seb4stien made their first contribution in #18
  • @nrobinaubertin made their first contribution in #31
  • @swetha1654 made their first contribution in #44

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/aproxy/commits/v0.0.1

releases.title: v0.6.0
releases.body:
• feat: look in .github and then root for the main config file #16
  • Add rtd docs instruction to update redirects when moving pages #15

releases.title: v0.5.0 - Add support for Agent Skills

releases.body: feat: Make Employee ID non-required field in profile by @DeeKay3 in #15
• Disabled the “Withdraw” button from the registration page after a registration is submitted.

• Country field is added to the profile. Country field in registration form is now activated and copies the value from profile.
  • Legal name is separated into “legal first name” and “legal last name”.
  • Certain fields ( CAP details, Employee ID ) are now blacked out in profile field, and not visible in the registration form by regular users. Admins can see them in the profile and edit them, and can see these values in registration forms. These values silently are copied to the registration form, and are only visible to the admins.

Charm Deployment v1.0.0

curl -L https://github.com/canonical/auditd-operator/releases/download/v1.0.0/auditd_amd64-v1.0.0.charm -o auditd.charm

# Deploy the charm
juju deploy ./auditd.charm

New Contributors

  • @Copilot made their first contribution in #11
  • @H-M-Quang-Ngo made their first contribution in #14

releases.title: Release v1.0.0
releases.body:
Charm Deployment v1.0.0

[Note]: the CIS functionality is not working yet in this release.

Download url: https://github.com/canonical/cve-scanner-operator/releases/download/v1.0.0/cve-scanner_ubuntu@24.04-amd64-v1.0.0.charm Example:

curl -L https://github.com/canonical/cve-scanner-operator/releases/download/v1.0.0/cve-scanner_ubuntu@24.04-amd64-v1.0.0.charm -o cve-scanner.charm

# Deploy the charm (requires cve-scanner snap as resource)
juju deploy ./cve-scanner.charm --resource cve-scanner-snap=./path/to/cve-scanner.snap

What’s Changed

  • 1. Structure build up by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #2
  • 2. Configs and Helpers by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #3
  • 3. Charm and exporter service implementation by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #4
  • 4. Alert rules by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #5
  • Some small fixes by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #7
  • Correct some alert syntax by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #9
  • CIS report functionality by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #10
  • Add CIS alert rules by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #11
  • Configure Renovate by @renovate[bot] in #6
  • Add charm artifact release workflow by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #14
  • Update actions/checkout action to v5 by @renovate[bot] in #17
  • Update GitHub Artifact Actions (major) by @renovate[bot] in #18
  • Update Jira sync config with new status and component by @Pjack in #20
  • Update actions/checkout action to v6 by @renovate[bot] in #25
  • Add rules for exit codes by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #13
  • Refactor prometheus rules & Add rule tests by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #27

New Contributors

  • @H-M-Quang-Ngo made their first contribution in #2
  • @renovate[bot] made their first contribution in #6
  • @Pjack made their first contribution in #20

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/cve-scanner-operator/commits/v1.0.0

releases.title: Release v1.0.0
releases.body:
Snap Installation v1.0.0

Download url: https://github.com/canonical/cve-scanner/releases/download/v1.0.0/cve_scanner_v1.0.0.snap Example:

curl -L https://github.com/canonical/cve-scanner/releases/download/v1.0.0/cve_scanner_v1.0.0.snap -o cve_scanner.snap
sudo snap install --dangerous cve_scanner.snap

What’s Changed

  • Configure Renovate by @renovate[bot] in #1
  • 1. Add foundation and scanning engine by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #4
  • 2. Landscape integration and PDF reporting by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #5
  • 3. Full Application by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #3
  • Add workflow to auto update osv-scanner by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #8
  • chore: update osv-scanner to v2.2.3 by @renovate[bot] in #10
  • Add snap artifact release workflow by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #11
  • chore: update osv-scanner to v2.2.4 by @renovate[bot] in #12
  • Add Jira sync configuration template by @Pjack in #14
  • chore: update actions/checkout action by @renovate[bot] in #13
  • Refactor metric collection implementation & Add new metric by @H-M-Quang-Ngo in #9

New Contributors

  • @renovate[bot] made their first contribution in #1
  • @H-M-Quang-Ngo made their first contribution in #4
  • @Pjack made their first contribution in #14

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/cve-scanner/commits/v1.0.0

Merge pull request #31 from canonical/fix/mismatch-content-name

commits.author: jneo8
commits.message:
fix: align content interface identifiers with microovn

Update content identifiers for ‘ovn-central-data’ and ‘ovn-chassis’ plugs to match the default slot names provided by the microovn snap. This resolves a connection mismatch that was causing the content interface connections to be denied by snapd.

Signed-off-by: jneo8 james.lin@canonical.com
